items.title: No Man's Sky Fugitive Run
items.content_html:
Finished a cool little permadeath fugitive run in No Man’s Sky last night. Just get through the center of Euclid, with some rpg restrictions:

  • No starter ship, normal space station, or Anomaly.
  • No talking to aliens/vendors etc except in pirate systems or if they land near me while I’m on foot
  • Need to use the ship builder to create an unregistered ship before leaving first system.
  • Pirate systems are ok
  • Can build base in caves of pirate systems

Took me 6 hours walking to find my first ship, a fighter, but then they started to come together quicker. Got up to 7 glyphs in the starter system and the first pirate system, so made a freighter, then found a portal to get close to the center.
items.content_text: Finished a cool little permadeath fugitive run in No Man's Sky last night. Just get through the center of Euclid, with some rpg restrictions: * No starter ship, normal space station, or Anomaly. * No talking to aliens/vendors etc except in pirate systems or if they land near me while I'm on foot * Need to use the ship builder to create an unregistered ship before leaving first system. * Pirate systems are ok * Can build base in caves of pirate systems Took me 6 hours walking to find my first ship, a fighter, but then they started to come together quicker. Got up to 7 glyphs in the starter system and the first pirate system, so made a freighter, then found a portal to get close to the center.

items.title: Monsters, Aliens, and Holes in the Ground
items.content_html:
Finished reading: Monsters, Aliens, and Holes in the Ground by Stu Horvath 📚

This was a great review of rpgs I’ve played or owned, and filled in on others, even ones I’ve not heard of. Ones I hadn’t thought of in ages, like the original TMNT and James Bond 007 books I had. Was interesting to learn about Vampire The Masquerade and other games I’d only associated with LARPing. He handled problematic games and/or authors in the beginning with a mention of some (like Empire of the Petal Throne) by acknowledging they exist but that they’re not in his collection or book because of the author’s… other work. I had been curious of EPT for a long time (they’re in some iteration of Appendix N, I think) but never read them due to their rarity, and was glad I hadn’t spent too much time or money tracking them down.
items.content_text:
Finished reading: [Monsters, Aliens, and Holes in the Ground](https://micro.blog/books/9780262048224) by Stu Horvath 📚

This was a great review of rpgs I've played or owned, and filled in on others, even ones I've not heard of. Ones I hadn't thought of in ages, like the original *TMNT* and *James Bond 007* books I had. Was interesting to learn about *Vampire The Masquerade* and other games I'd only associated with LARPing. He handled problematic games and/or authors in the beginning with a mention of some (like Empire of the Petal Throne) by acknowledging they exist but that they're not in his collection or book because of the author's... other work. I had been curious of EPT for a long time (they're in some iteration of Appendix N, I think) but never read them due to their rarity, and was glad I hadn't spent too much time or money tracking them down.

items.title: Gnucash Finance::Quote update
items.content_html:
Recent MacOS update broke the Perl/Finance::Quote/Gnucash axis, so GC couldn’t download quotes. Took a while to figure out that the chip architecture also fits into the issue, since Perl was updating F::Q to use an Apple Silicon version instead of the x86 version that Gnucash (currently running in Rosetta mode). Found fix here. Also required cleaning out Perl.

Just in case this happens again
items.content_text:
Recent MacOS update broke the Perl/Finance::Quote/Gnucash axis, so GC couldn't download quotes. Took a while to figure out that the chip architecture also fits into the issue, since Perl was updating F::Q to use an Apple Silicon version instead of the x86 version that Gnucash (currently running in Rosetta mode). Found fix [here](https://wiki.gnucash.org/wiki/Online_Quotes#Installing_Finance::Quote_on_macOS). Also required cleaning out Perl. 

Just in case this happens again

items.content_html:
LOTRO goals for February:

  • Finish up maxing crafting reputation tiers on minstrel & Lore-Master

  • Push minstrel to 150, maybe by going back and running through the epic that leads up to Umbar

  • Get brawler to 145, to open up the King’s Gondor & Umbar tasks

  • Gear up LM for the new instances

Not really in a huge hurry for any of this since we don’t know when the new instances will actually drop

* Finish up maxing crafting reputation tiers on minstrel & Lore-Master

* Push minstrel to 150, maybe by going back and running through the epic that leads up to Umbar

* Get brawler to 145, to open up the King's Gondor & Umbar tasks

items.content_html: Starting to convert one of the WideLoaders on the xtracycle to have a spot to hold a bicycle wheel in place, if/when we need to bail out on the way home from summer camp. During the process, snapped the plastic connector on the LongLoader. Put a replacement together in tinkercad, primitive but it works so far:[Printables] (https://www.printables.com/model/488721-xtracycle-longloader-connector)
